participants.bio: 24-year-old Computer Science student named Alex, female, highly familiar with VR and technology.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: You are now in the HeritageRoots virtual lobby. What do you notice first?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: The lighting and spatial sound immediately make it feel immersive. I noticed the floating panels, but wasn’t sure which gesture activates them.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Try navigating to a new scene using the teleport tool.

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: Teleportation is smooth, but I’d like a quick preview of where I’ll land. The fade helps, but maybe a clearer arrow would help directionally.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: How do the menus and icons feel to interact with?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: The icons are intuitive but slightly small. I prefer when menus curve around my view instead of staying flat in front of me.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Can you describe how object interaction feels?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: Picking up artifacts feels satisfying. However, I expected some haptic feedback when I grabbed something, maybe a small vibration.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Any technical or comfort issues?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: No lag, though the ambient sound loop is a little short—I noticed repetition after a few minutes.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: How would you rate the overall ease of use?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: Pretty intuitive overall. I’d just tweak interaction cues and maybe add a tutorial overlay at first launch.

transcript.text: Try navigating to a new scene using the teleport tool.

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: Teleportation is smooth, but I’d like a quick preview of where I’ll land. The fade helps, but maybe a clearer arrow would help directionally.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: How do the menus and icons feel to interact with?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: The icons are intuitive but slightly small. I prefer when menus curve around my view instead of staying flat in front of me.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Can you describe how object interaction feels?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: Picking up artifacts feels satisfying. However, I expected some haptic feedback when I grabbed something, maybe a small vibration.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: Any technical or comfort issues?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: No lag, though the ambient sound loop is a little short—I noticed repetition after a few minutes.

transcript.speaker: Interviewer
transcript.text: How would you rate the overall ease of use?

transcript.speaker: Participant
transcript.text: Pretty intuitive overall. I’d just tweak interaction cues and maybe add a tutorial overlay at first launch.
